reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Strengthening the National Response to Tuberculosis in Benin

description.narrative: Benin - Tuberculosis - National Tuberculosis Programme of the Republic of Benin - PNT. This program has the following goals: Réduire de 50% d’ici 2023, les nouvelles infections liées aux pathologies prioritaires : VIH, tuberculose, paludisme, hépatites, IST, maladie à potentiel épidémique// By 2023, reduce by 50% new infections related to priority diseases: HIV, tuberculosis, malaria, hepatitis, STIs, diseases with epidemic potential. Réduire de 60% d’ici 2023, la mortalité et la morbidité liées aux pathologies prioritaires : VIH, tuberculose, paludisme, hépatites, IST et maladies à potentiel épidémique// By 2023, reduce mortality and morbidity related to priority diseases by 60% : HIV, tuberculosis, malaria, hepatitis, STIs and diseases with epidemic potential.. Assurer une gouvernance intégrée et performante de la riposte nationale aux pathologies prioritaires et aux maladies à potentiel épidémique // Ensure integrated and efficient governance of the national response to priority pathologies and diseases with epidemic potential. The objectives of this program are: Le nombre de nouveaux cas de tuberculose toutes formes notifiées est augmenté de 24% en 2023 (4003 en 2018 à 4945 en 2023)//The number of newly notified cases of TB increases by 24% between 2018 and 2023(from 4003 in 2018 to 4945 in 2023).. Le taux de succès thérapeutique chez les nouveaux cas de tuberculose toutes formes et rechutes est porté à 90% en 2023// Percentage of all forms of TB cases (bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed) successfully treated (cured plus treatment completed) among all forms of TB cases registered for treatment reaches 90% by 2023. Le taux de décès chez les patients Co-infectés TB/VIH est réduit à au plus 10% en 2023 // The mortality rate among co-infected TB/HIV patients is reduced to less than 10% by 2023. Au moins 80% des malades multi-résistants mis sous traitement de 2ème ligne sont guéris en 2023 // At least 80% of patients with MDR-TB who are on treatment are cured, by 2023

participating-org.narrative: Instance Nationale de Coordination du Fonds Mondial de lutte contre le sida, la tuberculose et le paludisme au Bénin

title.narrative: BEN-T-PNT Progress Report
BEN-T-PNT Program Agreement 4
BEN-T-PNT Program Agreement 5
BEN-T-PNT Program Agreement
BEN-T-PNT Grant Performance Report
BEN-T-PNT Grant Performance Report
BEN-T-PNT Grant Performance Report
BEN-T-PNT Implementation Letter 1
BEN-T-PNT Implementation Letter 1
BEN-T-PNT Implementation Letter 2
BEN-T-PNT Implementation Letter 3
BEN-T-PNT Implementation Letter 4
BEN-T-PNT Implementation Letter 5
BEN-T-PNT Implementation Letter 6
Coverage / Output indicator for BEN-T-PNT
Treatment success rate of RR TB and/or MDR-TB: Percentage of cases with RR and/or MDR-TB successfully treated
TB/HIV-other 1: Percentage of HIV positive patients who have been screened for tuberculosis in HIV core facilities, among patients likely to become active TB patients within one year
Number of TB cases (all forms) notified among prisoners
Percentage of previously treated TB patients receiving DST (bacteriologically positive cases only)
Number of people in contact with TB patients who began preventive therapy
Percentage of new and relapse TB patients tested using WHO recommended rapid tests at the time of diagnosis
Percentage of bacteriologically confirmed TB cases successfully treated (cured plus completed treatment) among the bacteriologically confirmed TB cases registered during a specified period
Number of notified cases of bacteriologically confirmed TB, new and relapses

Treatment success rate- all forms: Percentage of TB cases, all forms, bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, successfully treated (cured plus treatment completed) among all TB cases registered for treatment during a specified period, new and relapse cases
Percentage of TB patients who had an HIV test result recorded in the TB register
Percentage of registered new and relapse TB patients with documented HIV status
Number of children <5 in contact with TB patients who began isonizide preventive therapy
Number of notified cases of all forms of TB (i.e. bacteriologically confirmed + clinically diagnosed), new and relapse cases
Percentage of TB patients with DST result for at least Rifampicin among the total number of notified (new and retreatment) cases in the same year
Percentage of HIV-positive registered TB patients given anti-retroviral therapy during TB treatment
Percentage of reporting units reporting no stock-outs of anti-TB drugs on the last day of the quarter
Percentage of HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients on ART during TB treatment
Number of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB that began second-line treatment
Number of TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB notified

Percentage of laboratories showing adequate performance in external quality assurance for smear microscopy among the total number of laboratories that undertake smear microscopy during the reporting period
Number of TB cases (all forms) notified among key affected populations/ high risk groups (other than prisoners)

DOTS-other 1: Number of cases of all forms of TB (TBAF) among children under 15 years (bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse), and as a percentage of all notified cases of TBAF
Percentage of people living with HIV initiated on ART who are screened for TB in HIV treatment settings
Impact indicator for BEN-T-PNT
TB mortality rate per 100,000 population
RR-TB and/or MDR-TB prevalence among new TB patients: Proportion of new TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB
TB incidence rate per 100,000 population
Outcome indicator for BEN-T-PNT

TB treatment coverage: Percentage of new and relapse cases that were notified and treated among the estimated number of incident TB cases in the same year (all form of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed)
Treatment success rate of RR TB and/or MDR-TB: Percentage of cases with RR and/or MDR-TB successfully treated
TB/HIV O-other1: TB/HIV death rate: Proportion of deaths among cases of TB/HIV co-infection detected
Case notification rate of all forms of TB per 100,000 population - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases
Treatment success rate of all forms of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases
Treatment success rate - bacteriologically confirmed TB cases
